meanings.definition: A surgical instrument used to control bleeding.
meanings.sent1: The nurse used hemostats to stop the bleeding after the surgery.
meanings.sent2: The doctor reached for the hemostats to clamp the blood vessel.
meanings.sent3: The hemostats were like magic wands, stopping the blood flow instantly.
meanings.sent4: Her quick thinking was like a pair of hemostats, swiftly stopping the problem in its tracks.
meanings.sent5: The shiny hemostats gleamed under the bright lights of the operating room.

meanings.definition: A tool used to clamp blood vessels during surgery.
meanings.sent1: During the operation, the surgeon carefully applied the hemostats to the blood vessel.
meanings.sent2: The hemostats were essential in securing the blood vessels during the procedure.
meanings.sent3: The hemostats were like tiny clamps, holding the blood vessels in place.
meanings.sent4: His precision with the hemostats was like a skilled craftsman at work.
meanings.sent5: The hemostats clicked shut, ensuring no blood would leak during the surgery.
